Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Aft \Aft\ ([.a]ft), adv. & a. [AS. [ae]ftan behind; orig. superl. of of, off. See {After}.] (Naut.) Near or towards the stern of a vessel; astern; abaft. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: aft adj : (nautical, aeronautical) situated at or toward the stern or tail [syn: {aft(a)}] [ant: {fore(a)}] adv : at or near or toward the stern of a ship or tail of an airplane; "stow the luggage aft"; "ships with square sails sail fairly efficiently with the wind abaft"; "the captain looked astern to see what the fuss was about" [syn: {abaft}, {astern}] [ant: {fore}]
